revisions.rev:
The '''Copa del Rey 1910''' were two different competitions held the same year. Due to disagreements between the reigning champion of the tournament, [[Club Ciclista de San SebastiÃ¡n]], and some of the clubs invited, in 1910 two parallel competitions were held: an "official", organized by the newly created [[Royal Spanish Football Federation]] (in [[Madrid]]) and an "unofficial", organized by the Spanish Union Football Club (in [[San SebastiÃ¡n]]). Both are currently recognized as official by the RFEF. ==Copa FEF== {{Infobox football tournament season | title = Copa FEF | year = 1910 | other_title = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | country = Spain | num_teams = 3 | defending champions = | champions = [[FC Barcelona]] | runner-up = | matches = 3 | goals = 14 | top goal scorer = | player = | prevseason = [[1909 Copa del Rey|1909]] | nextseason = [[1911 Copa del Rey|1911]] }} The competition started on March 22, 1910 and concluded on March 24, 1910 with the last group stage match, in which [[FC Barcelona]] lifted the trophy for the first time ever with 2 victories over [[Club EspaÃ±ol de Madrid|EspaÃ±ol Madrid]] and [[Deportivo la CoruÃ±a]]. ===Group stage=== {{footballbox | date = March 22, 1910 | team1 = [[FC Barcelona]] | score = 5–0 | team2 = [[Deportivo La CoruÃ±a|Deportivo]] | stadium = [[Madrid]] }} {{footballbox | date = March 23, 1910 | team1 = [[Club EspaÃ±ol de Madrid|EspaÃ±ol de Madrid]] | score = 3–1 | team2 = [[Deportivo La CoruÃ±a|Deportivo]] | stadium = [[Madrid]] }} {{footballbox | date = March 24, 1910 | team1 = [[Club EspaÃ±ol de Madrid|EspaÃ±ol de Madrid]] | score = 2–3 | team2 = [[FC Barcelona]] | stadium = [[Madrid]] | referee = Lemmel | goals1 = Buylla {{goal|5||12}} | goals2 = {{goal|58}} Wallace
{{goal|70}} Comamala
{{goal|89}} RodrÃ­guez }} {| align=center cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" style="background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" width=40% |- bgcolor=#006699 style="color:white;" !width=34% | Teams !width=5% | Played !width=5% | Won !width=5% | Drawn !width=5% | Lost !width=5% | GF !width=5% | GA !width=5% | Pts |- align=right bgcolor=#D0E7FF |align=left|'''[[FC Barcelona]]''' |2||2||0||0||8||2||'''4''' |- align=right bgcolor=#F5FAFF |align=left|'''[[Club EspaÃ±ol de Madrid|EspaÃ±ol Madrid]]''' |2||1||0||1||5||4||'''2''' |- align=right bgcolor=#F5FAFF |align=left|'''[[Deportivo La CoruÃ±a|Deportivo]]''' |2||0||0||2||1||8||'''0''' |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; margin: 0 auto;" |- ![[Copa del Rey]] 1910 Winners |- | '''[[FC Barcelona]]'''

[[Athletic Bilbao]] won the tournament for the third time. ===Group stage=== {{footballbox | date = March 19, 1910 | team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 2–1 | team2 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] | stadium = [[Ondarreta Stadium]], [[San SebastiÃ¡n]] }} {{footballbox | date = March 20, 1910 | team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 1–0 | team2 = [[Real Sociedad|Vasconia]] | goals1 = Iza {{goal|56}} | stadium = [[Ondarreta Stadium]], [[San SebastiÃ¡n]] | referee = Lavat }} {{footballbox | date = March 21, 1910 | team1 = [[Real Sociedad|Vasconia]] | score = 2–0 | team2 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] | stadium = [[Ondarreta Stadium]], [[San SebastiÃ¡n]] }} {| align=center cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" style="background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" width=40% |- bgcolor=#006699 style="color:white;" !width=34% | Teams !width=5% | Played !width=5% | Won !width=5% | Drawn !width=5% | Lost !width=5% | GF !width=5% | GA !width=5% | Pts |- align=right bgcolor=#D0E7FF |align=left|'''[[Athletic Bilbao]]''' |2||2||0||0||3||1||'''4''' |- align=right bgcolor=#F5FAFF |align=left|'''[[Real Sociedad|Vasconia]]''' |2||1||0||1||2||1||'''2''' |- align=right bgcolor=#F5FAFF |align=left|'''[[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]]''' |2||0||0||2||1||4||'''0''' |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; margin: 0 auto;" |- ![[Copa del Rey]] 1910 Winners |- | '''[[Athletic Bilbao]]'''
